results.title: Is Metformin Use Associated with Prolonged Overall Survival in Patients with Soft Tissue Sarcoma? A SEER-Medicare Study.
results.text_hl: ...BACKGROUND: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, an oral drug used to treat @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@, has been associated with prolonged survival in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with various @<m>DISEASE_Intestinal_Pseudo_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007418 @@@visceral carcinomas@@@.

citations.NLM: Hutchinson ID, Ata A, DiCaprio MR. Is Metformin Use Associated with Prolonged Overall Survival in Patients with Soft Tissue Sarcoma? A SEER-Medicare Study. Clin Orthop Relat Res. 2022 Apr 1;480(4):735-744. PMID: 34779790

results.title: [Effects of metformin on fatty liver in insulin-resistant rats].
results.journal: Zhonghua Gan Zang Bing Za Zhi
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Compared with the model group, the @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@insulin resistance@@@, liver index, @<m>DISEASE_Intestinal_Pseudo_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007418 @@@visceral adiposity@@@ and @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@ of the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group were dramatically ameliorated.

citations.NLM: Chen SQ, Liu Q, Sun H, Tang L, Deng JC. [Effects of metformin on fatty liver in insulin-resistant rats]. Zhonghua Gan Zang Bing Za Zhi. 2005 Dec;13(12):915-8. PMID: 16381638

results.title: Epidemiology, assessment, and management of excess abdominal fat in persons with HIV infection.
results.text_hl: In summary, the prevention and management of @<m>DISEASE_Intestinal_Pseudo_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007418 @@@visceral adiposity@@@ remains a substantial challenge in clinical practice.

citations.NLM: Moyle G, Moutschen M, Martínez E, Domingo P, Guaraldi G, Raffi F, Behrens G, Reiss P. Epidemiology, assessment, and management of excess abdominal fat in persons with HIV infection. AIDS Rev. 2010 Jan-Mar;12(1):3-14. PMID: 20216906

results.title: Metformin decreases meal size and number and increases c-Fos expression in the nucleus tractus solitarius of obese mice.
results.text_hl: These results indicate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-induced @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@ is associated with a sustained reduction in energy intake maintained by a reduction in meal size and number, and that oral administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ causes @<m>DISEASE_Intestinal_Pseudo_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007418 @@@visceral illness@@@ and neuronal activation in the NTS.

citations.NLM: Kim HJ, Zhang XH, Park EY, Shin KH, Choi SH, Chun BG, Kim DH. Metformin decreases meal size and number and increases c-Fos expression in the nucleus tractus solitarius of obese mice. Physiol Behav. 2013 Feb 17;110-111():213-20. PMID: 23391573

results.title: Pioglitazone (7.5 mg/day) added to flutamide-metformin in women with androgen excess: additional increments of visfatin and high molecular weight adiponectin.
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND AND AIM: Low-dose @CHEMICAL_Pioglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077205 @@@pioglitazone@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Pioglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077205 @@@Pio@@@), @CHEMICAL_Flutamide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005485 @@@flutamide@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Flutamide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005485 @@@Flu@@@), @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@) plus an oestro-progestagen is a novel polytherapy lowering total and @<m>DISEASE_Intestinal_Pseudo_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007418 @@@visceral adiposity@@@, and reducing carotid intima media thickness (IMT) in hyperinsulinaemic @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Virilism @DISEASE_MESH:D014770 @@@androgen excess@@@, without changing their body mass index (BMI).

Clin Endocrinol (Oxf). 2008 Feb;68(2):317-20. PMID: 18031315

results.title: Rutaecarpine ameliorates hyperlipidemia and hyperglycemia in fat-fed, streptozotocin-treated rats via regulating the IRS-1/PI3K/Akt and AMPK/ACC2 signaling pathways.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Administration of @CHEMICAL_rutecarpine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C028632 @@@rutaecarpine@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ significantly decreased @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Intestinal_Pseudo_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007418 @@@visceral fat@@@ accumulation, water consumption, and serum @CHEMICAL_Technetium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013667 @@@TC@@@, @CHEMICAL_Thioguanine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013866 @@@TG@@@ and LDL-cholesterol levels in fat-fed, @CHEMICAL_Streptozocin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013311 @@@streptozotocin@@@-treated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Non-alcoholic fatty liver and insulin resistance: a cause-effect relationship?
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@Insulin resistance@@@ provides a target for specific treatment of @DISEASE_Non_alcoholic_Fatty_Liver_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D065626 @@@non-alcoholic fatty liver@@@, and @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@-sensitising agents (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Thiazolidinediones @CHEMICAL_MESH:D045162 @@@thiazolidinediones@@@) as well as lifestyle changes to reduce @<m>DISEASE_Intestinal_Pseudo_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007418 @@@visceral adiposity@@@ are the most promising therapeutic options.

citations.NLM: Bugianesi E, Zannoni C, Vanni E, Marzocchi R, Marchesini G. Non-alcoholic fatty liver and insulin resistance: a cause-effect relationship? Dig Liver Dis. 2004 Mar;36(3):165-73. PMID: 15046183
